about_the_game:
About This Content


The Union Pacific of the 1960s was one of the most remarkable and compelling eras of railroading found anywhere at any time. New, potent second-generation diesels were arriving yet first-generation warriors carried on; Union Pacific’s unique double-diesel “super power” locomotives such as the EMD DD35A and GE U50 were riding the rails; and the railroad’s ever-memorable 8,500-horsepower “Big Blow” gas-turbine-electrics howled through the west.

Now, that extraordinary and unique era comes to life with Wasatch Grade Scenario Pack 01 for Train Simulator Classic!

Wasatch Grade Scenario Pack 01, created by accomplished developer High Iron Simulations, recalls in ten realistic career scenarios the Union Pacific of the 1960s on the rugged Union Pacific Wasatch Grade route stretching between Ogden Utah and Evanston, Wyoming, famous for its scenic passage through Weber and Echo Canyons and daunting climb of the Wasatch Mountains.

With Wasatch Grade Scenario Pack 01, you’ll experience authentic and challenging 1960s Union Pacific intermodal, freight, local, and switching operations, and you’ll take the controls of no less than seven types of locomotives to battle tonnage and Wasatch Mountain grades.

With Wasatch Grade Scenario Pack 01, you will:

- Climb aboard and take the throttle of Union Pacific’s 5,000-horsepower, eight-axle EMD DD35A to highball a priority Pacific Fruit Express produce train eastward over the full and challenging length of the Wasatch Grade.
- Handle the throttle of a stylish Union Pacific EMD GP30 as you work the Fourth Subdivision’s local eastward with switching work to handle en route to Echo.
- With a UP EMD GP35 on the point, call upon a 15,000-horsepower diesel lash-up to lift a heavy train of Utah-mined coal up and over the summit of the Wasatch Mountains.
- Work a city transfer job through the labyrinth of trackage between Rio Grande’s Ogden Yard and Union Pacific’s Riverdale Yard.
- Highball a hot piggyback train westward on a wintry morning at the throttle of Union Pacific’s gargantuan General Electric U50 double-diesel.
- Call upon a veteran Union Pacific Electro-Motive GP9 to work the Park City Branch local as it makes its way from Echo to Riverdale Yard.
- Aboard a classic set of Union Pacific EMD F7 “covered wagons,” lift a heavy livestock train up the Wasatch’s tough and unrelenting mountain grades.
- Experience taking the throttle of 8,500-horsepower as engineer of Union Pacific gas-turbine-electric (GTEL) No. 1 on an end-to-end eastbound manifest freight run of the Wasatch Grade route.

Experience all the appeal, excitement, and challenges of Union Pacific railroading during the remarkable 1960s – with Wasatch Grade Scenario Pack 01 for Train Simulator Classic!

Included Scenarios


The ten career scenarios of Wasatch Grade Scenario Pack 01, based closely on actual railroad operations, offer a remarkable and enthralling opportunity to experience realistic and memorable railroading during an era of unmatched motive power verve and diversity.

Included Career Scenarios:

  • PFE Produce East, Pt. 1
  • PFE Produce East, Pt. 2
  • Fourth Subdivision Local
  • Utah Coal
  • Local from Park City
  • UP Piggyback East
  • UP Extra 1 West, Pt. 1
  • UP Extra 1 West, Pt. 2
  • Ogden Transfer Run
  • Cattle Drive on Rails

Download size: 10.4 MB

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum for 32-bit:
  • OS *: 32-bit Windows 7 Service Pack 1, 8.1 or 10 Required (Other OS versions and types are not supported)
  • Processor: Intel Core-i3 4330 3.50 GHz Dual Core or AMD A8 6600K 3.90 GHz Quad Core or Better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 750 Ti or AMD Radeon R9 Graphics with 1 GB Dedicated VRAM or Better
  • DirectX®: 9.0c
  • Network: Broadband Connection (May incur additional costs for use)
  • Storage: 40 GB or more available space (Additional Add-Ons will require more)
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Audio Device
  • Additional Notes: Requires mouse and keyboard or Xbox Controller
Laptop, Notebook, Mobile or Low Power versions of the above specifications (including Intel or Integrated Graphics) may work but are not supported. Updates to Chipset, Graphics and Audio Device Drivers may be required. For information relating to recommended specifications for Train Simulator 64-bit, please refer to the Train Simulator Classic User Guide.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended for 32-bit:
  • OS *: 32- or 64-bit Windows 7 Service Pack 1, 8.1 or 10 Required (Other OS versions and types are not supported)
  • Processor: Intel Core-i5 4690 3.50 GHz Quad Core or AMD Ryzen 7 1700 3.80 GHz Quad Core or Better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM (maximum possible under 32-bit Windows)/16 GB or Better (For 64-bit Windows)
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 or AMD Radeon RX 480 with 4 GB Dedicated VRAM or Better
  • DirectX®: 9.0c
  • Network: Broadband Connection (May incur additional costs for use)
  • Storage: High Performance SSD Recommended with 40 GB or more available space (Additional Add-Ons will require more)
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Audio Device
  • Additional Notes: Requires mouse and keyboard or Xbox Controller
Laptop, Notebook, Mobile or Low Power versions of the above specifications (including Intel or Integrated Graphics) may work but are not supported. Updates to Chipset, Graphics and Audio Device Drivers may be required. For information relating to recommended specifications for Train Simulator 64-bit, please refer to the Train Simulator Classic User Guide.
